title_sort: walt whitman to herbert gilchrist, 25 december [1878]
title: Walt Whitman to Herbert Gilchrist, 25 December [1878]
text: Camden New JerseyDec 25—p mYours of day before yesterday rec'dreceived—I am well as usual, & bustling about—Sister and brother well—Bitter cold & gusty gales here for two days—I don't go out so much—Went over Sunday morning to foot of Arch St. Phila. to breakfast on a steamer—bountiful breakfast—jolly democratic three hours—I have written to Miss Jenny G.—I sent John Burroughs your Brooklyn address—he & wife are away spending Christmas holidays—I shall send him your present address—havn't seen E's portrait yet—I am writing this up in my room—Sun shines out as I finishW WMerry Christmas to you & all Walt Whitman to Herbert Gilchrist, 25 December [1878]
